website_summaries.verdict: An easy way to get ground meat for small batches of homemade burgers and sausages.
pros: Attachment fits all household KitchenAid stand mixers
Large blades grind meat with ease, while thinner blades are ideal for homemade breadcrumbs
cons: For large batches you may have to stop periodically to clean the blades

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're buying (don't!)
customer_reviews.text: Where to start... I read people having metal shavings in their food, but I thought that was an operator error and went ahead and purchased the grinder anyway. Boy, was I wrong. Bottom line: if you need extra iron in your diet, look no further, this is the product for you. For the rest of us, stay far away. It just sucks I'm 2 days over 1 month return policy... I'd give zero start if it was an option.
customer_reviews.author: Marro

customer_reviews.title: Its a love-hate thing
customer_reviews.text: We have grown tired of the local ground meat offerings. Bought this so we can make our own mince out of a higher quality meat than the butcher offers. Love this because I can now grind my own lamb burgers for only $5 a pound (costco leg of lamb). The best burgers EVER Hate this because it's not actually grinding the meat as much as tearing it to bits. I should have bought the stainless steel version.
customer_reviews.author: US.AU.NZ

customer_reviews.title: Dull and worthless
customer_reviews.text: The edges on this grinder are very dull. The meat I tried to grind kept jamming or turning into paste because the same chunk of meat would start to go through two holes in the coarse grinding plate at the same time, and there wasn't anything sharp enough to cut the meat into multiple pieces. After a few minutes of using the grinder the first time I started to get metal shavings in the meat. The only meat that was actually cut by this grinder was my finger, as ironically the tool that is provided to disassemble the grinder DOES have sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Henry

customer_reviews.title: It's just junk.  Spend some more $ for an all-metal grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Just absolutely do not ever buy this product. I bought it and didn't use it for a month, then when I did, the plastic screw cap broke with the pressure of the process of grinding meat, on the first use. The return window closed so I'm out of luck and stuck with plastic garbage.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Not Kitchenaid quality.
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage. I used the plastic Kitchenaid predecessor to this model for over 20 years and it finally gave way. That didn't bother me. When I went to replace it with this one, the construction and engineering tolerances of this one are a waste of time. You have to tighten the ring down so hard that you get a constant stream of metal filaments in your sausage mix and it causes the unit to work necessarily harder. If you don't tighten enough, meat squeezes out the collar. The new blade is so cheap and light I can't imagine it lasting more than a season. Kitchenaid would do better to keep its quality and reputation high regard less of cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it, I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this attachment because we buy a quarter cow every year and it comes with quite a few roasts that we never end up eating because my wife can't cook the damn things to save her life. So I decided to grind them up for hamburger instead. Good tips in these comments from others especially about using partially frozen cuts of meat. I tried completely thawed just to see and it gums up the blades pretty bad. Also, clean the blades often while you're grinding as bits of sinew and fat will get stuck on the blades and make grinding difficult. I like it and have ground close to 40lbs of hamburger without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Superdad

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well when the meat/fat is trimmed right
customer_reviews.text: I have used it about five times now. It works pretty well when the meat/fat is trimmed right. Once in a while the fat would jam up the machine. I ground about 10 pounds of meat at a time, and it takes about/less than half an hour, including trimming. Clean up is easy. The first time there was this black sludge coming out in the middle. I used the cap of a pen to contain it, as suggested by another reviewer. The black stuff reduced drastically after the first use. I don't have to use the cap anymore, just pick out the yucky stuff as it comes out about every five minutes. Not perfect, but works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: AnniePooh

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed my KitchenAid mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item back in 2014 and had used this attachment maybe 5 times; I just don't grind a lot of my own meat. After the last time, I learned I wouldn't be doing anything else with my mixer ever again, because the mixer started to smell funny as the motor burned up. It appears that attaching this too tightly to the mixer will cause this problem. If you insist on using this product, make sure your mixer is under warranty. Really sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Astrodonkey

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean
customer_reviews.text: This does a mediocre job grinding, the blade gets jammed and then has to be disassembled to keep using it. The worst part, theres a small metal piece where the corkscrew meets the housing, that gets full of meat and is completely impossible to clean. I've tried a bunch of different brushes but nothing actually gets it clean. I'll be throwing this out and replacing with a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Oblivious

customer_reviews.title: Good option for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to grind venison. Trimmed the meat carefully, sliced into small pieces, and ran the meat through coarse then fine dies. I looked at the big commercial types at cabelas. If you're starting a meat processing business or processing every day you should go that direction. This one isn't built as tough as those. However, for my occasional home use this was a lot cheaper and takes up less space and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: A&JFarm

customer_reviews.title: Black Sludge
customer_reviews.text: I used this about seven times with great success. Today however when I was grinding some turkey a dark sludge appeared in the center of the grinding output. When I took it apart, deep inside there is a metal disk which has discolored and has dark surrounding it. I will try to upload a picture. It is really hard to get to it but I made some success using a pointy knife over a washcloth. Even tried brushes and can't get it totally clean. So my warning is to pay attention to that area when cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: bb148

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the one that originally came with my 30 year old Kitchen Aide Mixer. All of the attachments that came with my mixer kit rapidly cracked at the shaft even though they were made of thick plastic. This one works but is smaller and thinner than the original. I noted that the newer ones are made of metal but were too expensive considering I don't use it much at all.
customer_reviews.author: KaolinKuntry

customer_reviews.title: Grinder will not stay attached.
customer_reviews.text: The shaft of the grinder does not insert fully into my 4.5 quart Classic Plus mixer which I bought 3 days prior. Without it inserting fully, the small tapered hole on the shaft will not line up with the hole and retaining screw on the mixer. I contacted Kitchen Aid and they took the model and serial number of my mixer and said they would send me a replacement and to please return the "bad" one to them. About 2 weeks later I received a replacement grinder and guess what? Exact same problem. Also, there was no return label or any other information in the box. I now have 2, brand new, useless grinders. Bleh.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Saves Money!
customer_reviews.text: Retired from Meat Dept, I have used the best grinders they make. No, this is not for commercial use, but for home use it serves my purpose. I use it all the time for grinding beef and pork roasts to make ground beef and pork. Yes, sometimes one will have to detach and wash the skin or gristle off the worm (drill looking piece). So try and purchase lean roasts to avoid this step or cut the raw meat smaller. Easy on and off and secure feeling. I would recommend this product to all and thanks to the maker for saving me $$$ grinding my own!
customer_reviews.author: Java Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Light duty instrument
customer_reviews.text: Although I was able to complete my project with the grinder I did notice some black grease coming out of my Kitchenaid motor. I believe that it was caused by the strain of overloading the grinder. I mitigated the problem by cutting the meat into smaller pieces and forcing them through slowly. The smaller pieces worked, but that meant more work for me. I suppose you just have to be patient and it will do the job. If you have a lot to grind, sausage perhaps; you will probably need a stainless steel meat grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila L. Gray

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed with the quality of the new item
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that this is a kitchenAid product. My old grinder purchased from bedbathand Beyond. It had two small cracks on the neck. so I bought this new grinder from Amazon. I was so disappointed with the quality of the new item. It took more than twice time to grind the pork comparing with the old one. so I get my old grinder from the cabinet. and I started to use my old one. . I don't understand why? I wish I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Hong Liu

customer_reviews.title: Easy grinding in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I like to make a ground sandwich spread (we call Coney Island) that is made of ground bologna and grated cheese, pickle relish and mayonnaise. Using mhy Kitchen Aid mixer attachment make the chore so easy and I soon have my picnic sandwiches made -- refrigerated -- and ready to pack into the cooler for a fun day with grandchildren. Cleanup is so easy -- Rinse attachment with hot water spray at kitchen sink over the garbage disposal and then stick into dishwasher to do an easy end of the cleanup! This is only one way to make an easy solution to a task I used to dread.
customer_reviews.author: capricorn60us

customer_reviews.title: No need for the metal version...
customer_reviews.text: Great Kitchen Aid attachment. I owned the metal version for years. (Unfortunately broke during a move). Since I only use this tool a few times a year during BBQ season, I simply purchased the “plastic” version to save a few bucks. It’s the exact same mechanism. Just as sturdy on the inside. Fine, it doesn’t look as good, but it performs just as well and feels the same (weight, performance, attachments). With the money you save, buy the sausage attachment... it’s only a piece of plastic, but super fun to use. I also think it’s beyond cool to say you made your own sausages... ;) It’s a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: M.R

customer_reviews.title: Work Great for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly to grind meats for sausage. I have used this attachment about 6 times. This is primarily only for home use, and goes too slow for any large quantity work. It does get messy and meat covered during use. The cleaning of the interior grinding area is easy. All the moving parts are removable. You will need a scrubbing tool to clean out the tubular areas of the grinder. After the initial cleaning of the unit, I usually just put all of the white pieces in the top rack of the dishwasher for additional disinfection.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Super grinder
customer_reviews.text: Well built like all kitchenmade products, only down side it that when using it as a casing stuffer to make sausage it’s a bit tedious as you have to constantly keep it packed with one hand and hold the casing with the other. The ram doesn’t allow for much air to pass by when using it for this and thus causes air in the sausage witch could cause botchulism. However that’s not the products fault so much as microbial. If your using this to grind your meats up to make patties or veggies it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Addition
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. It attaches right onto the front of my Kitchen Aid mixer. There are two options in regards to how you want the meat to come out. Thin or thinner. It assembles very easily and only has a few pieces to clean. (Be sure to take it apart before using and remove one of the two pieces that the meat passes through.) I ground up strip steak yesterday and it came out in perfect ground beaf hamburger form. I also ground up Sirloin and pork for meatballs. It’s quality made and I am very happy with it. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I watched an episode of Beat Bobby Flay where a contestant made meatballs by grinding two different types of meat, I've wanted this attachment. Got it a few months ago and am very in love. I'd definitely recommend getting one. It's easy to use, safe, a pain to clean but they all are. It is worth the investment, especially if you like to eat ground meats that are more expensive in the grocery store. For example, I can get chicken breasts for $2.99 a pound, but they won't grind it for me and the stuff that is ground is more expensive. I can just buy the cheaper whole product and then grind it myself!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey West

customer_reviews.title: It’s plastic but has worked so far
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that it turned out to be made of plastic - auger as well. Does work but wondering if it will hold up under normal use. It may have the kitchen aid name but not the quality I was expecting. Found out later that you can still get the metal one but at an exorbitant price..t
customer_reviews.author: katie simms

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Works Well for Lean, Non-Gristly or Fiberous Meats
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient way to grind some cubed meat into a ground mixture. I haven't used it for sausage or any other task, so I can't comment on that. I find that if there is much fat or fiber in the meat, I have to periodically remove the piece on the front where it will get trapped as it exits the grinder, but it still does a good job. I think if you are grinding a high volume of meat and the meat has a lot of fat or a fair amount of fiber, you may need something more heavy duty or industrial strength. It has a nice finish that makes it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: DreamerKW

customer_reviews.title: A piece of kitchen junk
customer_reviews.text: I would love to return it but it took over 2 months before I got to use it. I couldn’t return it anymore. All I can say that it’s a piece of kitchen junk. I cut a piece of pork into strips so it could go into the grinder. While it’s grinding, the 2 metal pieces (cutter and filter) were grinding against each other. I’d found pieces of black stuff in my meat and you could see it in the photo. I believe that it’s metal dust of some sort. Also, it wasted lotsa meat. A lot of it is stuck in the grinder that is ungrinded as seen in photo.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what kitchen aid stand mixer this is made for - but it certainly isn't mine. The part that goes into the mixer doesn't fit properly and because of that the grinder constantly turns while grinding meat. It is impossible to use.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Ruggieri

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Used to grind organic chuck roast into my own hamburger. Then used to grind uncured bacon to mix with some low fat organic meat that is traditionally low fat and dry. For someone trying to avoid meats with hormones and antibiotics this comes in handy. You can make your own blend of hamburger, sausage, meatballs, etc. I did also purchase some extra blades for a little larger grind and the sausage attachment. There are more attachment options on Amazon that might even be a little better than what comes with this.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, but there are some things that can ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, but there are some things that can trip you up. It will help immensely if you put the meat in the freezer for a while first, so the grinder doesn't gum up. When working with the sausage stuffer, I've found it helps to push the meat all the way down, rather than packing it in halfway, then adding more.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked it, however this was short lived. There are two major issues in terms of lasting quality. First, the leading edge of spiral shaft started peeling, delaminating and introducing unknown pvc contaminants into ground food (see pics 1-3). Second, I noticed there is black unknown substance aggregating at the bottom of shaft chamber and probably also entering my food chain (pic 4). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Max Zelenin

customer_reviews.title: Quality Attachment for KitchenAid Mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I coordinated the purchase of a Kitchenaid Mixer with my kids and mother in law as a Christmas Gift for my wife. It was in the popular color pictured above. She loved it and was pleasantly surprised that the whole family came together to get it for her. The meat grinder attachment I got for her separately but really wanted it for myself. It appears to be of very high quality and attaches to the power outlet in front of the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: SJKey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, recommend
customer_reviews.text: No corkscrew grinder of mine has ever been easy to clean, but this one is much easier than some others I have used and can usually be cleaned and put away in 20-30 minutes, depending on what steps you chose to take. I always like to add a little bleach to the water (Cool) and do an initial breakdown and dispose of unground by product.
customer_reviews.author: Palmerino C.

customer_reviews.title: Make your own sausage for a fraction of the price! Great attachment.
customer_reviews.text: We were intent on making our own Boudin. It's labor intensive, but delicious and certainly makes Boudin affordable for us, since we can make it for about $3 lb vs. the $13.76 from our local meat shop. I will say that threading the sausage casing has been an interesting experience. You must lube the heck out of it with crisco, or you will spend WAY too much time threading the casing on. Once we got the hang of it, it went pretty well.It does bog down a bit, but that is the motor strength of the particular Kitchen Aid that I have, I'm sure. It's not speedy, is what I'm saying.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine Bickerstaff

customer_reviews.title: grind steak into your own burgers!
customer_reviews.text: does the job...but i would have paid more for the mechanism to be metal instead of plastic. It binds up quickly with that film that is on steak meat. It also squeezing out meat where you twist the cap on. The blades inside of the mechanism are very small and not very sharp. But...for the money...I am happy, and glad to be grinding my own hamburger meat....Most meat from the grocery stores are brought into the markets, not ground at the store. The reason I bought this was that the ground beef at the store has so much water, and i have no idea what else it has in it. Now, I know exactly what is in my burgers...
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wall

customer_reviews.title: Works, cheap, cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.text: It works. It’s inexpensive compared to a standalone grinder. I’ve only used it a couple of times. Grinding brisket trimmings hoot frozen) was painful, the tendons get stuck in The blades & clog the mechanism up. I ground some pork shoulder I cubed (no freezing) which just flew out of the device. Easily disassembled for cleaning. Though plastic, seems to be of better quality. Unit seems & operates very solid. Used it with mixer on high.
customer_reviews.author: Ronbo East Texas

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very useful. I can now grind the meat myself, insuring the freshness of what I eat, which is important to me, rather than buying chopped meat. I just buy the meat I need while it is fresh, and then grind it myself, There is nothing better to eat something so fresh, when you do it yourself, It's easy, fits perfectly well in the Kitchen Aid, easy to use and clean. A must for those cooks out there.
customer_reviews.author: mynou

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea and the design
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and the design, it's so convenient and helpful working with the kitchenaid machine. The 2 problem I'm concerning is, the screw has some hole on it, I'm not sure it's factory defective, the replacement is the same problem, which is easily for bacteria to get stuck in if you don't wash it very carefully. The other problem is, the blades got rusted the first wash, which is not good, the holes on the blades are too small to wash the rust off. I still like the idea, just hope they can have better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Yuan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite attachment.
customer_reviews.text: If you've got the mixer, you need this attachment. Grinding your own meat lets you buy inexpensive cuts and grind them fresh. You don't have to worry about how long that ground meat at the store has been sitting there, and plus most grocery stores double grind their meat, making for an inferior product. The difference is noticeable, plus you can do fun things like custom mixed grinds or grinding up a piece of bacon with your beef.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D

customer_reviews.title: Works great to grind up elk roast into elk burger! Easy assembly, easy cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to attach to my KitchenAid mixer so that I could turn elk roast into elk burger! This works great and it saves me a lot of money, because I don't have to buy a separate grinder. If I were grinding up a lot of meat at a time I'd definitely consider buying a totally separate grinder, but for now this is perfect for my needs! Easy to assemble, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: funincolorado

customer_reviews.title: Much better than plastic
customer_reviews.text: Love this attatchment! So much better than the plastic version. I placed mine in the freezer for 30 minutes to an hour before making my sausage. So easy to clean (soap and water). The cleaning tools provided with the unit are great. The box the holds the unit and parts is so sturdy it works great for storing as well.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: doesnt grind meat well
customer_reviews.text: if you are grinding super lean meat this works well. if you are grinding fatter cuts of meat the fat and tendons get caught in the grinder and you have to remove it all to start over. we ended up using our food processer
customer_reviews.author: s.tsang

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We purchased this to replace a manual food grinder, you know the kind that you crank by hand. :-) The manual grinder was purchased for us 30+ years ago by my mother-in-law. Each time we used it we would think of her, and were hesitant to replace it for sentimental reasons. But if she were here today, I think she would have one of these too! It makes the job of grinding food fun and is simple to assemble and disassemble for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: A must in the house
customer_reviews.text: I love this handy attachment for my mixer. I have only grinded meat so far in this grider attachment and it works great. Of course this is not the grinder you would find in meat markets, its definitely a little slow but gets the job done. Super easy to take apart to clean and reinstall back together. Really makes my life a lot easier when i want to grind fresh meat for burgers or whatever. I know exactly what Ingredients are being grinded together and not suspecting the quality of ground beef anymore
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Was Skeptical but I love it. Best price from the seller
customer_reviews.text: It worked great on slightly frozen meat sliced in strips. I even put onions, garlic, etc. in it to mix it all up. It didn’t get clogged and everything pushed through somewhat easy. Clean up was a breeze as the parts all come out. For anyone on the fence about buying one of these bad boys, wait no longer and get it! No more store bought mystery ground beef. The package came quick and in good condition. Amazon finally got one right!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have used this many times, it works pretty good if you follow the directions. It needs to be taken apart to clean out during use sometimes, mostly for raw meat. I used the metal one years ago, and I remember having to do that with it too. Grinds cooked meat and vegetables for ravioli just fine. I also grind meat for burger, and use it to make crab cakes. Overall, I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Leaky tray/hopper, too small design, plugs up fast
customer_reviews.text: Processing tomatoes, well cooked, apart from leaky hopper/tray, the auger plugs up quickly prior to finishing a single 7 qt canner load. Disappointing, but does work, and is cheaper than the superior SQUEAZO model. Victorio food mill works better, but I might rate this slightly higher since it's motor driven.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Young

customer_reviews.title: MMMM meat
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my kitchen aid. The only issue that I run into is when I am grinding fatty meat or fat it can get jammed. I found that freezing it to a semi hard state makes it much easier to grind. Not great for veggies, but then again it is a meat grinder not veggie musher. Easy to attach and super easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Meat gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: After a month of using it, I would give it 3/5. It tears the meat more than grinding it & definitely is not for heavy duty grinding. For small chunks of meat, it is OK. Be careful not too screw the cap on too tight, because 1) the plastic doesn't withstand it well and 2) I feel that small black deposits show up in the meat when I screw the cap tightly. For casual/occasional use, I'd recommend. Otherwise, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving this product. I followed the directions that came with and even watched a YouTube video from Kitchenaid to ensure I wasn’t wasting any food from the first use. It worked like a charm on chicken. It was easy to use and my ground chicken came out even better than I expected. It is a bit time consuming to clean but I’ve only used it for meat and I was really thorough so to not worry about cross contamination or food-borne illness.
customer_reviews.author: Shellsome

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Not a lot of power.
customer_reviews.text: This was about what I expected from the product. It worked well and will be used a lot in my house. That said it is not a dedicated meat grinder. It seems slow and low on power compared to a stand alone grinder. As we are always trying to reduce the number of small appliances we have stored in our kitchen this works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: JBrookie

customer_reviews.title: Works great for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: We don't grind a ton of meat, just needed something reliable that would get the job done without costing a fortune and taking up a bunch of counter space. We've only done about 10 pounds of meat at a time, no issues, as with many grinders works easier if meat is partially frozen. Easy to assemble and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could grind my own ground beef because I noticed that the price of a chuck roast or sirloin was cheaper per pound than packaged ground beef. It works great and the the ground beef it produces tastes fantastic. In fact, it is so good that we would rather make burgers at home than go out. Very easy to clean and most of the pieces are dishwasher safe. For best results, cut your beef into about 1 inch wide, 3 inches long, and about 1/2 inch thick then pop it into the freezer for about 20 minutes before grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Best burger I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: 1 lb of chuck, 1/4 lb sirloin, 3 strips of bacon = fluffy meat flavor cloud of a burger. Store bought ground beef is now a thing of the past in our family thanks to this device. The plastic plunger is a little weak feeling but it works well enough. Cleaning is a bear but it does get very clear with a little bit of work.
customer_reviews.author: B. sindelar

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for home canning or freezing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the KitchenAid Fruit/vegetable strainer and the food tray accessory attachments to puree tomatoes. I didn't realize that I also needed the food grinder attachment until I was ready to process the bushel of tomatoes. Thank goodness for Amazon and Prime membership. I ordered the food grinder and had it within days! The grinder works great. I'll also use it for applesauce this fall. Highly recommend these attachments if you do any home canning or freezing. Makes the hard work much easier. By the way, that bushel of tomatoes went fast. They're now in the freezer labeled Neopolitan sauce. We'll enjoy that this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Jude

customer_reviews.title: I’m thrilled to be able to ground my own meat again and have enjoyed its results
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected, however the plastic is not the highest quality. For something that will experience quite a bit of pressure (from the ‘stuffer’), I’m concerned about its ability to last. In any event, I’m thrilled to be able to ground my own meat again and have enjoyed its results. My last mixers attachments were metal, for which I am more comfortable with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for sausage stuffing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grinder in hopes to use it mainly for sausage stuffing. I can't comment on the meat grinding itself. For stuffing, it works very poorly. The meat for sausages is usually finely ground and is akin to dough. Since the opening is very narrow, you can't put much meat in there and since it is tall, it causes air vacuum issues and the meat doesn't want to go down even when pushed using the plastic utility. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: mmedic

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder. I got it for nuts, but know it will work good for anything. I make Potica and my old grinder was so hard to use, but this is great! I also used it for grinding bologna and hard cooked eggs to make mock ham salad for a funeral. Worked wonderfully. So glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: My first meat grinder.
customer_reviews.text: As is the nature of any meat grinder, no meat grinder is super easy to clean. Any crevice collects meat to be picked. Regarding use, highly recommend placing this unit in the freeze prior to use. Otherwise pork meat will “melt” more than grind. But those who make sausage regularly already know this helpful technique. For the price, highly recommend for a beginning sausage maker such as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt grind anything without hassle and leaves metal shards in your food
customer_reviews.text: Came here to try to figure out why we couldnt get any meat, regardless of fat content, to grind without coming out looking like sludge and jamming up every few minutes. Saw a bunch of negative reviews about this product also leaving shards of metal in the grind and what do you know, metal shards everywhere. Just threw ours in the trash. Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Randell Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Better than restaurant steak burgers!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to the home cooks Kitchenaid Stand Mixer attachments. I love using it for making my own ground beef for burgers (my favorite), grinding pork for bratwurst and italian sausage and have even made all beef hot dogs! The bowl, auger, blades, and collar are all easily removed for quick and easy cleaning. It's so simple to use you'll be grinding ribeye, chuck, and sirloin into your own mixture for burgers on the grill in no time....and you'll never want to buy pre-ground beef again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this grinder about 6 times since I purchased it. I have only used it for grinding chicken breast and chicken thigh meat, but I really like it. The majority of the grinder it is made out of plastic, but I haven’t had any issues with it so far. It gets the job done, while being relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: JMI

customer_reviews.title: Five star
customer_reviews.text: This is my second grinder and it's the same quality as the old school one I had. My last one lasted 13 years so this one has some big shoes to fill. As long as you dice/slice the meat properly and get a good chill on it, the grinder will work great and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: My husband hunts and we got this grinder to help process his deer this year. The grinder worked great (got jammed a few times, had to take a part to clear out) and seemed to hold up pretty well. I think this grinder will hold up another year but i’m not sure how much longer than that. For the price; it’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Metal with your meat?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. If I’m lucky to get it to actually grind the meat metal shavings always comes out in the meat. I’ve tried several times with various meats (beef, chicken, turkey) and have the same issue every time. Kitchen Aid quality isn’t what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: Nice attachment
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is easy to use, like all KitchenAid attachments. Make sure you use the disc with the larger holes if you want bits & chunks when processing vegetables, the smaller holes gives more of a mush.
customer_reviews.author: Brent E.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $5 let alone $35.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Does not grind. Doesn't even shred meat. I Would not purchase again. Return window closed, and it was not returnable after 30 days. It wasn't used for 90 because it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: SAVO

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, Came very fast, Packaged well and exactly as described with a great deal. set it up instantly so i could make homemade burgers from top great beef, also added in some cheeses and herbs. Ground perfectly and tasted aewsome.. BUY THE KITCHEN AID MIXER and the attachments.. awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen darling

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is really only good if you are doing really small infrequent batches
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is really only good if you are doing really small infrequent batches. Like less than a pound. It is a pain to use, and is really slow. I also bought the sausage stuffing attachment, which isn't worth the money either as it is exceptionally slow. I get gray ooze when i'm grinding meat, i think its either metal/metal contact causing it or maybe grease dripping down from the KA, and the motor gets pretty hot after a while. A full metal body would be alot better as the plastic doesn't hold cold well. Self powered grinders look like they are only slightly more expensive than just this attachment.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. Set up, use, and clean up was a breeze! I used it to grind pork and ham for a recipe. It definitely did what I needed it to do! Would have preferred it in metal, but I knew I was ordering plastic, so can't really complain. Overall, very good product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but still not too pleased. Works well other than that
customer_reviews.text: There is something black that oozes out of the place where the crank goes into the plastic/metal housing. Not every time i use it, just sometimes. Not very much, just enough to make me wonder. Dunno why. Dont think it gets out into the food...but still not too pleased. Works well other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Loni

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder. Easily ate throught pounds of pork
customer_reviews.text: Good grinder. Easily ate throught pounds of pork, chicken, and wild game. It has already almost paid for itself. I can make sausage for about 1.50$ / lb vs 3.99/lb for name brand stuff. Others have complained that it isn't easy to clean, but it is not bad if you clean it right after use. I use a bottle brush to clean the passages. I have not used it to grind vegetables or fruits but i imagine that it would work fine for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: savings monger

customer_reviews.title: Other reviews are true...not safe for food processing
customer_reviews.text: The aluminum part inside of the grinder is not coated and releases oxidized metal dust as it grinds meat. Not safe to use to process food. (Hand washed using cold water before use, so it has nothing to do damaged coating, there is no coating to start with.)
customer_reviews.author: SZ

customer_reviews.title: Metal shavings causing grey/black goo in meat!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I did a search and realized I am no the only one to have this problem. I had no idea what was causing the grey/black deposits in my ground meat. From all of my searching today it seems to be from metal shavings mixing with the meat. I also found a video showing the metal shavings when running the machine dry. This attachment is going in to the trash and I will be buying an electric grinder. Even without the "goo" on my food this attachment would have only received 3 stars from me. It will grind meat, but not very well in my opinion. I can only recommend people stay away from this attachment!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: very lightweight plastic, grinds meat like it should
customer_reviews.text: grey goop that everyone talks about is there, pain in the butt to clean, meat should be almost frozen. All things considered though it does do what it should and allows for custom hamburger blends to be made (never used it to make sausage)
customer_reviews.author: bryan pearson

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent product. I doubt the longevity of the main body, as it is plastic (sturdy, but still plastic), but the grinding parts are all sturdy materials. I used it to grind my whitetail deer meat this season, and it did very well. One thing that multiple reviewers mentioned is metal shavings in their food. Well I FOLLOWED THE INSTRUCTIONS and it did just fine with no metal shavings and no issues. It does not grind fast, but it grinds well for being an attachment and not a dedicated grinder.
customer_reviews.author: TheTeej

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat KitchenAid products
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Grind my own burgers with trimmings from other meats (i.e. T-bone, round roast, chuck roasts, etc.) I get the best eating from well trimmed beef buys AND great hamburger ground with the ratio of fat to meat I want. The attachment works well with my KitchenAid Professional 6 mixer and is simple to clean. I recommend storing in the refrigerator or freezer so that it is ready to use (always grind meat chilled through a chilled grinder to minimize bacteria.) The price was about the same as a manual clamp-on-to-shelf style which appears very difficult to clean and would require a lot of cranking to do the job that this KitchenAid attachment does in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Ivanhoe

customer_reviews.title: Grinding plate and the blade not sharp!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I own the KitchenAid appliance so I wanted the original KitchenAid meat grinder to go with it. We was so excited when we ordered this item. Everything looked nice and new, I read all the directions how to use this attachment. Then we wanted to make fresh juicy burgers. We cut the beff meat in little squares and frozen them for 40 minutes. After that I put the meat in the grinder and turned on.....the plastic ring didn't hold the pressure and busted......so here we are still hungry. The grinding blade and the grinding plate was totally dull, not sharp at all.
customer_reviews.author: Iveta Hajkova Corbitt

customer_reviews.title: An excellent attachment and must have for your kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the KitchenAid mixer. It easily ground a large semi-frozen chuck roast, and did not bog down. Meat came out perfectly ground. Taking it apart was simple, and clean up under the faucet was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Devil Dave & Allie

customer_reviews.title: Sweeney Todd would be jealous...
customer_reviews.text: We used to use an old school hand grinder... this is far, far, far superior. It made processing deer meet a breeze and we've used it to grind down beef for jerkey. The nozzle attachments to make sausage are really helpful. We've also used it to make our own salsas. I am very happy with this purchase. Be aware that it is plastic, though, so if you are using meat that was frozen, be sure to completely thawed first.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: i was totally dissatisfied. Surprised that Kitchen Aid would ...
customer_reviews.text: i was totally dissatisfied. Surprised that Kitchen Aid would make something that was 90% plastic and engineered so poorly. i bought it to stuff sausage. it takes forever, and is painfully slow. there is no way one person can stuff sausage. it takes 2 people. one to hold the casings, and one to try and push meat into the feed tube. meat was everywhere, the push stick has a very sloppy fit, so meat is always going around. meat leaks around the grinder head nut ( no gasket) not to mention the tray is too small, and the feed tube being tapered only holds a small amount of casing... old saying... buy cheap, buy twice
customer_reviews.author: mike heath

customer_reviews.title: Another reason to love your KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make fresh food for my cats. It works wonderfully. I can choose the larger grinder disk to give them enough substance to chew on or the smaller, if I want to hide something in other food. The cat's coats are getting softer and glossier as they are eating food which is closer to what they would eat as hunting animals. Great investment, solidly made and easy to clean. Oh yes, and I can use it for the family meals too :)
customer_reviews.author: Diane G

customer_reviews.title: Great attachment
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for making deer burgers. Was defiantly a help. They came out great. I will be using it again in the future. Plus side to using the plastic attatchment instead of the metal, it does not have that dark residue coming off after being washed. The plastic attatchment came clean very easily.
customer_reviews.author: JEANNIE S.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm with very cold cubed meat.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to order this grinder due to it being mostly plastic. Once it arrived and put it to use, I was very happy with its performance. I suggest using cubed meat that is very cold, near freezing temperature to get great performance and keep the cutting blade cool.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: ... this as often as I should but we always enjoy the sausage when I do use it
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this as often as I should but we always enjoy the sausage when I do use it. It is a pain to clean but if you just get a good brush you will have no problems. It does take a lot of work and I have found even if I do keep the meat cold like the directions say it tends to clog which adds a lot of time to the process. Overall I am not sure I would go back and buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: amazonut

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is very easy to clean and works really really well
customer_reviews.text: This is the first grinder I’ve ever owned. Prior to buying this grinder are used to use my food processor and it would take me time to get it cleaned up after each use.. This grinder is very easy to clean and works really really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much, I'm not overly serious about grounding meat, so I haven't done a lot with it, but it is so simple to use and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson Brackett

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid Food Grinder Attachment
customer_reviews.text: I've so far ground bacon and figs in this so I can attest to the fact that it grinds bacon and figs very well. I would note that when grinding something fatty like bacon it helps to have it be semi-frozen. I am very pleased with how it functions and suspect it will see a lot more use this summer.
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Worked like it was designed to work
customer_reviews.text: I have used it three times, followed instructions and on line review tips. ground and made 8 pounds or country sausage. Worked like it was designed to work. It was quite operating, had no jams, easy cleaning and for the price small enough to store with ease. I ground only pork,- Boston Butt- and let it chill in freezer 30 min. between the two grindings. For the price should have came with stuffer kit..
customer_reviews.author: Joel Walters

customer_reviews.title: It came in perfect condition, and I have no issues with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This attachment works well, but its a bit of a chore to clean. I expected that however when I purchased it to grind fresh meat for hamburgers and meatballs. It came in perfect condition, and I have no issues with the product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Krems

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, hopefully metal version is better
customer_reviews.text: Was working ok for the first six months (of fairly light usage). Fell apart after that including completely busted inner seal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Melnikov

customer_reviews.title: The blade is NOT properly made
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that it is not properly made. The blade is kind of soft. When I grind meat, the friction between the blade and the worm assembly causes metal fall off! Every now and then I have to check the grounded meat and throw away the iron filings. I decided to buy the pricy blade and grinding plates from Butcher-Maker (reviewers claim that their's are better made than the original ones) to see whether it can improve. Given the new set is about the same price as the food grinder attachment itself (total ~$100), I should have invested in a pricy food grinder of a lot better quality.
customer_reviews.author: hippoppih

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder! Put on my lederhosen and haven't taken them off I'm having so much fun! This thing has me frolicking about, grinding up meat and singing about the hills being alive (actually, Run To The Hills... I'm a huge Maiden fan). I love the power it shows when I drop my meat in the hopper, and the sound of grinding flesh is refreshing on a hot summer day. I shouldn't tell you how I love tossing my meat in spices and just grinding away. That's when the magic happens.
customer_reviews.author: Malin Parker

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: So, I have used this twice so far. The first time was to make ham salad. Worked like a charm. The second time I was using to ground up beef for hamburger...... it worked, but I missed some gristle I would to plug it up.... a metal one might have worked better for the beef! But worth the price I got it for!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s not the best but it does a decent job.
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheaper to buy it here then in store. But the problem is that the meat needs to be very small before it could be passed through the grinder.It’s not the best but it does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great/small grinder. Not for large batches
customer_reviews.text: Made 75lbs of Sausage. This grinder works fine. Must prep meat into small cuts. It is not high capacity or fast working but it did what I needed it to do. Better for smaller use. I have a 1/hp commercial unit now for large batches. This one works wonderfully for small runs.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: My husband uses this to make ground chicken
customer_reviews.text: This attached perfectly to our kitchen aid mixer. We got a whole chicken, deboned it, and ran the meat, skin, and seasoning through the grinder. My husband had read the using the skin in the mix would add fat to the ground meat, however, the grinder didn't do a good job of dealing with the fat & skin. Next time, well just add olive oil to the mix. Anyway, the meat turned out great and we used it in sauces & wraps, as well made some chicken burgers with it. Next time he'll try the KA SSA sausage stuffer kit to make some chicken sausage.
customer_reviews.author: brm

customer_reviews.title: Rabbits-no problem.
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to purchase because figured you get what you pay for and had been looking at the meat grinders at Rural King and the like for $100. Figured that this thing would take a nose dive quick or do a poor job. Decided what the heck give it a whirl. Let me tell you it made mince meat out of the rabbits we raise. Ran them through once on the big holed plate then mixed in my spices and ran them through the small holed plate. Was ground up better than the beef we get from meat packers. Has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Too much stress on the motor
customer_reviews.text: This grinder attachment is OK if you're only making small batches (less than 15 pounds) of sausage and if you only use it once or twice a year. But if you make larger batches or if you use it more often, you should invest in a real stand-alone meat grinder. I've made my own sausage at home for about ten years now, and this poor grinder attachment just isn't up to the job. I finally ended up having to replace my wife's stand mixer and buy my own grinder. A stand-alone grinder is much easier to use and much simpler to clean. Same goes for stuffing. A hand-cranked canister stuffer is much easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time finding ground chicken in my area. I already had the KitchenAid mixer so I though I would give this grinder a try. It is easy to assemble and take apart for cleaning. It also did an excellent job grinding chicken breasts. So far that is the only thing I have tried in it, but I imagine that beef would grind just as easy. I have yet to buy a KitchenAid product that I have not loved. They really think through their design process and make excellent products.
customer_reviews.author: BeckySC

customer_reviews.title: Works very nicely
customer_reviews.text: Thanks everyone for the valuable feedback. The attachment fitted our KitchenAid perfectly and did a very nice grind on chicken thigh meat. We used the coarse blade and partially froze the meat as advised.
customer_reviews.author: Amrita

customer_reviews.title: Not like the KitchenAid products from several decades back.
customer_reviews.text: My last one split down the length of the body from the proximal end to 1/7 of the complete distance. I was not amused and considered getting an all metal version HOWEVER I read too many complaints of issues Consumers were having with their metal devices. So I'm sticking with this plastic device. It's predecessor never had issues other than stress failure after a decade and two years of nearly daily use. As a KitchenAid product, I expect it to last a lifetime. HOWEVER we live in a wasteful age now where excellent quality no longer matters and people are terribly wasteful. Sad to say, this is not my mother's KitchenAid. Three stars and only three.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

product_meta.title: KitchenAid Food Grinder Attachment
product_meta.description:
Style Name:FGAGet grinding. Transform your KitchenAid Stand Mixer into a versatile food grinder that uses the power of the motor to help you tackle a variety of tasks. The coarse grinding plate is great for grinding raw meats for burgers or meatloaf and combining ingredients for homemade salsa, while the fine grinding plate quickly grates hard cheeses and helps you make bread crumbs. For everything you want to make. KitchenAid.

AMAZON.COM
This tool increases the fun factor of your KitchenAid stand mixer several times over. Toss cubes of meat into the food tray, stomp 'em down, and watch the results wriggle out the front. Grind your own beef or chicken for patties or tacos. Blend your own sausage mixtures, from breakfast to boudin blanc. With additional attachments, you can turn it into a pasta maker or a sausage stuffer. It's easy to assemble and use. Most parts are dishwasher-safe; hand wash the grinding blades, food stomper, and cutting knife. --Betsy Danheim

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid

See more
feature_bullets: Powered by your KitchenAid Stand Mixer. Fits all Household KitchenAid Stand Mixers. (Grinder not included)
Fine Plate to grind meats and dried breads.
Coarse Plate to grind firm fruits, vegetables and cheeses.
Grinder attachment greatly expands a stand mixer's flexiblity
Ideal for grinding meats, grating cheese, making bread crumbs and combining dips, salsas, spreads
Includes fine and coarse grinding plates, tips, and recipes
Most parts dishwasher safe for easy clean-up
Grinder can be used with any KitchenAid stand mixer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,628 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
